pandaEditor.directorywatcher module¶

class pandaEditor.directorywatcher.DirectoryWatcher(root=False)[source]¶

Bases: Thread

Class for watching a directory and all subdirectories below it for changes.

onAdded(filePaths)[source]¶
onModified(filePaths)[source]¶
onRemoved(filePaths)[source]¶
run()[source]¶

Main watcher function. Don’t use this to start the watcher, use start() to run the daemon instead.

setDirectory(dirPath)[source]¶

Set the directory for watching.

class pandaEditor.project.Project(base)[source]¶

Bases: object

Build(buildPath)[source]¶

Build the project to a p3d file.

CreateAsset(filePath, contents)[source]¶

Base method for creating a file asset in a project folder.

CreateBuildScript(fileName)[source]¶

Return the python script responsible for building the project. This is pretty inflexible at the moment, but the user should be able to change how this script is generated in the future with some option boxes.

CreateCgShader()[source]¶

Create a new cg shader in the shaders directory.

CreateDirectories(dirNames)[source]¶
GetMainScript()[source]¶
GetProjectDefinitionPath()[source]¶
GetRequiredSysPaths()[source]¶

Return a list of all paths needed to be on sys.path for the build process to run. Remember to replace backslashes with forward ones.

GetScenesDirectory()[source]¶

Return the full path to the scenes directory.

GetScriptsDirectory()[source]¶

Return the full path to the scripts directory.

GetShadersDirectory()[source]¶

Return the full path to the shaders directory.

ImportAsset(file_path)[source]¶
New(dirPath, **kwargs)[source]¶
Set(dirPath)[source]¶
SetDirectories()[source]¶
get_directory(dirType)[source]¶

Return the full path to the indicated directory type.

get_project_relative_path(file_path, directory=None)[source]¶
get_rel_model_path(pandaPath)[source]¶

Attempt to find the indicated file path on one of the model search paths. If found then return a path relative to it. Also make sure to remove all extensions so we can load both egg and bam files.

get_unique_asset_name(startName, dirPath)[source]¶

Return a unique asset name.

property models_directory¶

Return the full path to the models directory.

property prefabs_directory¶

Return the full path to the prefabs directory.

pandaEditor.scene module¶

class pandaEditor.scene.Scene(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Scene

close()[source]¶

Destroy the scene by removing all its components.

deregister_connection(connection)[source]¶
get_incoming_connections(comp)[source]¶

Return all incoming connections for the indicated component wrapper.

get_outgoing_connections(comp)[source]¶

Return all outgoing connections for the indicated component.

load(file_path)[source]¶

Recreate a scene graph from file.

register_connection(source, target, name)[source]¶

Register a connection to its target component. This allows us to find a connection and break it when a component is deleted.

save(file_path)[source]¶

Save a scene graph to file.

pandaEditor.selection module¶

class pandaEditor.selection.Selection(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Object

BBOX_TAG = 'bbox'¶
GetNodePathUnderMouse()[source]¶

Returns the closest node under the mouse, or None if there isn’t one.

GetPickableNodePath(np)[source]¶
StartDragSelect(append=False)[source]¶

Start the marquee and put the tool into append mode if specified.

StopDragSelect()[source]¶

Stop the marquee and get all the node paths under it with the correct tag. Also append any node which was under the mouse at the end of the operation.

add(comps)[source]¶

Add the indicated components to the selection and run select handlers.

clear()[source]¶

Clear the selection list and run deselect handlers.

get()[source]¶

Return the selected components.

get_node_path_at_position(x, y)[source]¶
property node_paths¶
remove(comps)[source]¶

Remove those components that were in the selection and run deselect handlers.

select_child()[source]¶

Return a list of child components from the selection. Include the original component if no children are found.

select_next()[source]¶

For each component in the selection, return the component that appears one after in the parent’s list of children.

select_parent()[source]¶

Return a list of parent components from the selection. Include the original component if no suitable parent is found.

select_prev()[source]¶

For each component in the selection, return the component that appears one before in the parent’s list of children.

update()[source]¶

Update the selection by running deselect and select handlers.

pandaEditor.showbase module¶

Bases: ShowBase

Create an empty scene and set its root node to the picker’s root node.

GetEditorRenderMasks()[source]¶

Return the show, hide and clear masks for objects that are to be rendered only in the editor viewport.

LayoutBothView()[source]¶

Deactivate both display regions and enable mouse.

LayoutEditorView()[source]¶

Deactivate both display regions and enable mouse.

LayoutGameView()[source]¶

Deactivate both display regions and enable mouse.

OnMouse1Down(shift=False)[source]¶

Handle mouse button 1 down event. Start the drag select operation if a gizmo is not being used and the alt key is not down, otherwise start the transform operation.

OnMouse1Up()[source]¶

Handle mouse button 1 up event. Stop the drag select operation if the marquee is running, otherwise stop the transform operation if a gizmo is being used.

OnMouse2Down()[source]¶

Handle mouse button 2 down event. Start the transform operation if a gizmo is being used.

OnMouse2Up()[source]¶

Handle mouse button 2 up event. Stop the transform operation if a gizmo is being used.

OnProjectFilesModified(filePaths)[source]¶
OnUpdate(comps=None)[source]¶

Subscribed to the update selection message. Make sure that the selected nodes are attached to the managed gizmos, then refresh the active one.

ResetModelPath()[source]¶

Clears the model path, making sure to restore the current working directory (so editor models can still be found).

SetActiveGizmo(name)[source]¶
SetGizmoLocal(val)[source]¶
SetupCameraMask()[source]¶

Set camera mask to draw all objects but those with the first four bits flipped. All editor geometry will use these bits so as to not be rendered in the game view.

SetupEdCamera()[source]¶
SetupEdMouseWatcher()[source]¶
SetupEdRender()[source]¶

Create editor root node behind render node so we can keep editor only nodes out of the scene.

SetupEdRender2d()[source]¶

Creates the render2d scene graph, the primary scene graph for 2-d objects and gui elements that are superimposed over the 3-d geometry in the window.

SetupGizmoManager()[source]¶

Create gizmo manager.

SetupGrid()[source]¶

Create the grid and set up its appearance.

SetupRenderMask()[source]¶

Set the draw mask for the render node to be visible to all cameras. Since we are adjusting the draw mask of the render node’s parent we need to manually set this node’s mask or it will inherit those properties.

StartTransform()[source]¶

Start the transfrom operation by adding a task to constantly send a selection modified message while transfoming.

StopTransform()[source]¶

Stop the transfrom operation by removing the selection modified message task. Also create a transform action and push it onto the undo queue.

pandaEditor.utils module¶

pandaEditor.utils.indent(elem, level=0, indent_size=4)[source]¶

pandaEditor.utils.popen_and_call(OnExit, printStdout, *popenArgs, **popenKWArgs)[source]¶

Runs a subprocess.Popen, and then calls the function onExit when the subprocess completes.

Use it exactly the way you’d normally use subprocess.Popen, except include q callable to execute as the first argument. onExit is a callable object, and popenArgs and popenKWArgs are simply passed up to subprocess.Popen.
